content: lola hat a knitting pattern by erin gates 1 © lizzy knits llc 2017 included are instructions for four sizes and are noted in the pattern as follows newborn baby child adult finished measurements newborn hat height 4 5 circumference 13 will fit head size 13-15 baby 6-12 months hat height 5 circumference 16 will fit head size 16-18 child hat height 7 circumference 18 will fit head size 18-21 adult hat height 8 circumference 21 will fit head size 21- 24 materials 40 58 80 90 yards worsted weight yarn i used hobby lobby s i love this yarn us 5 double pointed needles or circular needles for magic loop us 7 double pointed needles or circular needles for magic loop **note for adult size you will need to use the circular needles not all the stitches will fit on the dpns stitch marker tapestry needle tape measure gauge 16 stitches and 22 row make a 4 square using us 7 needles abbreviations co- cast on pm- place marker sm- slip marker rm- remove marker dpns- double pointed needles sts- stitches k- knit p- purl 2 © lizzy knits llc 2017 pattern using us 5 needles of your choice co 52 66 72 84 sts join in the round be careful not twist your sts pm sm at the beginning of every round work k1 p1 ribbing to the end of the round for 6 8 12 14 rounds switch to us 7 needles of your choice knit each round until the entire piece measures 4 5 5 7 8 from the cast on edge rm divide sts evenly on 2 needles 26 33 36 42 on each cut yarn from ball leaving a tail about a yard long thread the tail through a tapestry needle and kitchener stitch the opening closed for a nice invisible seam when all the sts are off the needles pull the working yarn tight until the top seam measures 6 5 8 9 10 5 across make sure the seam is nice and smooth and then tie off the yarn and weave the end inside the hat finishing up the ears also see photos below i used a contrasting color thread for the sake of the tutorial but use the same color as the hat for yours cut a piece of scrap yarn about a foot long and thread through a tapestry needle lay your hat on a flat surface weave the yarn as follows 1 measure 1 5 2 2 5 3 down the side of the hat from the corner insert the tapestry needle into this point on the side of the hat starting from the side facing you and coming out the back of the hat 2 measure 1 5 2 2 5 3 across the top of the hat from the corner this point and the point that you previously measured will form a diagonal line when the yarn is completely woven through for now use this new point
